> Dear Friends,
>
> I've read the early drafts of GOJOU HAJIME, a
> work=
 of yaoi so here is my review of the work...
>
> Whereas well known films l=
ike TABOO/GOHATTO move
> at a meditative pace and leaves key narrative them=
es
> up to viewer interpretation GOJOU HAJIME is the exact
> opposite.  The=
 novel's pace is very even and balances out
> the chapters by switching bet=
ween the various pairings and
> leaves *nothing* to the imagination.
>
> Wh=
at struck me the most about GH is the tone or voice of the
> writing is ver=
y youthful and matches the age range of the
> main characters.  One will no=
tice how effective this "voice" is
> in regards to the Hajime and Okita pai=
ring.  The humorous interaction
> between the more mature pairing, Hijikata=
 and Kondou is absolutely
> exciting and contrasts with the dominance and s=
ubmission psychology in
> the Toudou and Serizawa couple.
>
> The homosexua=
lity in the work deviates for a refreshing mxf romance
> I'll not reveal he=
re.
>
> My only complaint is I wanted more action. I hope that the female l=
ead
> becomes more developed in the sequel.
>
> GOJOU HAJIME is a relaxing =
read where the plot is based on emotional
> and physical reaction between c=
haracters.
>
> [BLURB]
> During Japan's 1800's the samurai

sfied with the shogun

Barbarians. Many

re their emperor

rt swordsmen
> to manage the revolution. Given the
> name, Shinsengumi (New=
ly Selected
> Corps), the brave men were
> commissioned to eliminate the un=
ruly
> samurai and ronin, sanctioned to kill.
> The men lived for the momen=
t, for their
> lives could end in an instant. Under
> stressful circumstanc=
es some of the
> men turned to one another for comfort,
> but how far did t=
hey venture from there

l, gay, yaoi,
